Message.Title: How would romney try to run(ruin) the country?
Message.Msg: I believe in capitalism and have no problem with people acquiring wealth but I object to how some of them acquire their wealth. Romney's job at Bain was to increase the wealth of his already wealthy investors. But he achieved that by loading divisions with debt, selling bonds to outside investors (including state pension funds), bankrupting the debt burdened division and sending jobs offshore. Money from bond sales and borrowed money was paid to the wealthy Bain investors as dividends. They walked away with millions while workers lost jobs, pensions, and benefits. State pension funds are still suffering today because of those bond purchases - not because of union contracts! Creditors were left with unpaid invoices for goods and services so they lost a bundle, maybe some of those businesses failed as a result. But Romney succeeded in making money for Bain investors. He cannot do that with the U.S. government. He can't load Virginia with debt and then close it down and divide the remaining money among the rest of the nation. If a hurricane devastates North Carolina, Romney can't fire them and tell them we can't invest any more money in the state. That's how he succeeded at creating wealth. How will he run the country?

Topic.Title: romney deducted $77,000 for horse care in 2010

Message.Msg: Oh, dear. I see you need more schooling. Let me see if I can put this in terms you might understand. 1. In order to claim a DEDUCTION (refer to my original response regarding the difference between a deduction and a credit which you keep calling it) on a business you must own a business to begin with. 2. The Romney's did not run a horse business (or hobby). In other words, the Romney's did not make any money nor did they attempt to make any money on that horse in 2010 (the year you claim they received a 77G tax "credit". 3. Q1: How can you receive a tax "credit" (or deduction for that matter) on something you never used to make money in the first place? 4. Q2: If you don't have a business do you think the fed. gov. is going to give you a $77G tax credit on the loss of said nonexistent business? 5. Q3: I agree Obama's policies are absurd but how f'in stupid do you think he allows the IRS to be? 6. The Romney's did not attempt to make any money on that hobby horse therefore did not qualify for nor receive a tax "credit" (or deduction). 7. If the Romney's ever decide to use the horse for business income they will then qualify for a tax deduction on any losses or pay taxes on any profit from the venture. Profit - Expenses = profit or loss. See how that works? 8. I have no intention of clicking on your DemocRATic links for the twisted version of the facts. It's not necessary.

Topic.Title: romney deducted $77,000 for horse care in 2010

Message.Msg: I cannot find a copy of the only tax return Romney had the temerity to release, but it appears from reports he claimed deductions for the business of whatever in the amount of $77,000. The loss could be challenged as a hobby as you imply and then it would be up to the Romney's to demonstrate a profit motive. Going to the Olympics is not a profit motive in itself, but selling an Olympic horse might be their ultimate payoff and excuse for a profit motive. Such an argument could be made, but I do not know if it would play well among the public. You are right that the loss is a deduction and not a credit and at Romney's tax bracket may have only saved him 12 to 20 thousand dollars. Still, that is one heckuva loss to claim and it insults the majority of American people who can only look in awe at what is spent on that horse. The link you didn't want to follow is probably one of the ones that compares what the average American spends on health care and transportation and finds it less than Horse Romney.

Topic.Title: romney deducted $77,000 for horse care in 2010

Message.Msg: Ms Midnite, again, love ya even though we're on opposite political teams. Overall thanks for trying to keep the intelligent discourse (or as one of our most clever posters put it "intelligent disc horse") going inspite of the trailer park boys, but please stick to the facts as your team is most sadly in need of that. First, Romney hasn't apoligised for his wealth, there are a slew of quotes where he and his wife rub peoples faces in it. And any apology is not going to get those folk their jobs, companies and towns back. Obama is not saying that's a crime. Obama is a Wall Street lapdop and is not trying to criminalize wealth. Even if he rolls back some of the obscene tax breaks the rich get (which he really does not have the heart for) even ill gotten wealth like the Romney's won't be criminalized. Personally, I'd like to see people who bankrupt companies and fire workers and the rich who say they need wealth to create jobs (only in china) and offshore their casino winnings be treated like drug lords and mobsters. Everything seized for the good of a sinking nation. And finally, those who watch more than Fox "News" know Obama's entire quote was (to paraphase) 'if you have a successful business, you didn't build it by yourself, there were your parents, the folks who built the roads and bridges, the government that built the internet' and we pay our taxes to pay that back, and pay it forward. He forgot to say 'and the Indians we stole the land from' and our children to our great granchildren we stole the resources from', but you get the idea. Successful business men did not create their wealth simply by being smart or working hard, especially in the new guilded age of vulture capitalism, preditory lending and offshoring everything. Neither candidate is truly addressing the gross inequalities, but the whole "trickle down" theory has long been discredited as it all (the jobs, the businesses, the schools and services 'trickled down' to China, Guam and other now successful economies. Personally if I ripped off my community and hid the money in the Cayman's they'd seize it and jail me. Most people just want the laws enforced equally.

Message.Msg: Glad we can talk about this freely & openly. :) I was being sarcastic when I said Romney apologizes for being wealthy. Sarcasm is my second language and I need to be more aware of how it can be taken literally. My belief is wealth is nothing to be ashamed of or apologize for. That is unless the wealth is obtained by shady means. I don't know how all those offshore dealings work so I can't comment on that but I don't condone tax evasion if that's what it comes down to. Below is the precise Obama quote on business. Here is the YouTube video to listen to as you read along. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YKjPI6no5ng "If you were successful, somebody along the line gave you some help. There was a great teacher somewhere in your life. Somebody helped to create this unbelievable American system that we have that allowed you to thrive. Somebody invested in roads and bridges. If you've got a business, you didn't build that. Somebody else made that happen. The Internet didn't get invented on its own. Government research created the Internet so that all the companies could make money off the Internet." Was Obama talking about teachers? roads & bridges? the internet? or was he talking about businesses? Obama now claims he was saying businesses didn't build roads and bridges. LOL It's pretty clear to me that he said it exactly as he meant it. He was talking about and discrediting American businesses (he always has) and I take issue with that. By the way the government didn't build the internet. Another Obama lie is his claim that the borders have never been more secure when the opposite is true according to border officials. Have you heard about this. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xb2_3R6oHSQ If you or I did what that alien did we'd be thrown in jail. Boarder officials have been told they will lose their job if they don't let in the democrats...er...I mean "dreamers".
